alert.note: Alert for Orange (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 6:29PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Orange County through 715 PM EDT... At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Glen Spey, or 9 miles northwest of Port Jervis, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Middletown, Port Jervis, Howells, Cuddebackville, Otisville, Huguenot and Deerpark. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern New York.
